content.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the amount of a substance that is contained in something, especially food or drink
content.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: water with a low salt content
content.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc
content.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing, and camera work.
content.translation[0].definitions[2].de: the information contained in a website, considered separately from the software that makes the website work
content.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The graphics are brilliant. It’s just a shame the content is so poor.
content.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Andy was a good husband, and Nicky was clearly very content.
We’ll be content with a respectable result in tomorrow’s match.
content.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a feeling of quiet happiness and satisfaction
content.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to make someone feel happy and satisfied
content.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: I was no longer satisfied with the life that had hitherto contented me.
content.translation[4].definitions[0].de: the things that are inside a bag, box, room etc
content.translation[4].definitions[0].ex: The contents of the suitcase were seized by the police.
content.translation[4].definitions[1].de: the things that are written in a letter, document, book etc
content.translation[4].definitions[1].ex: He refused to disclose the contents of the report.  (=say what was in the report)
content.translation[4].definitions[2].de: the amount of a substance that is contained in something
content.translation[4].definitions[2].ex: The beer has an alcohol content of 2.6%.
Coal has a high sulfur content.
content.translation[4].definitions[3].de: the materials, parts etc that a product contains
content.translation[4].definitions[3].ex: Eight states require a minimum percentage of recycled content (=materials that have already been used) in packaging.
